summary: Henry B. Gonzalez is identified as an authorizing official on payroll authorization forms for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His signature appears on documents related to staff payroll records, indicating his role in approving employment, salary adjustments, and other personnel actions within the HSCA. The documents span from 1976 to 1978, reflecting his involvement during the committee's active investigation period. The consistent pattern across the documents is his authorization of payroll-related actions for HSCA staff, suggesting an administrative or oversight role within the committee's operations.
significance: Henry B. Gonzalez's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his role as an authorizing official within the HSCA, specifically related to staff payroll. While the documents do not directly reveal his involvement in the investigative aspects of the assassination, his authorization of payroll actions indicates his participation in the administrative functions of the committee.
